intro: Fimbristylis viridecarinata, commonly known as the green-ribbed sedge, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Cyperaceae. It is characterized by its grass-like appearance, with narrow, linear leaves and spike-like inflorescences. The plant typically grows in wetland or marshy environments, thriving in moist, acidic soils. Its small, greenish flowers are clustered in dense spikes, and it produces small, three-angled fruits. Fimbristylis viridecarinata is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, contributing to the biodiversity of wetland ecosystems.
